summary: This testimony discusses how the federal government manages unneeded property—an issue on our High Risk List . A 2016 law set up a 3-round process to select and prepare these federal buildings for sale. Proceeds from prior rounds of sales go into a fund to help pay upfront costs for the next round. However, some participating agencies said they faced setbacks. Delays in selling 1st-round...
title: Federal Real Property: Lessons Learned from Setbacks in New Sale and Transfer Process Could Benefit Future Disposal Efforts
